metadata.Description: Foundational data infrastructure refers to the basic infrastructure required for collecting, storing, and managing data.

level 1.Description: Foundational data infrastructure addresses the issue of energy access by providing accurate and reliable data on energy availability and distribution.
Foundational data infrastructure employs data analytics to analyze energy-related data and derive insights for decision-making and policy formulation.
Foundational data infrastructure collaborates with energy grid operators to ensure the efficient and reliable transmission of energy.
Foundational data infrastructure supports energy planning efforts by providing accurate data on energy consumption, demand, and infrastructure.
Foundational data infrastructure administers an energy data platform that centralizes and manages energy-related data for easy access and analysis.
Foundational data infrastructure measures energy efficiency by collecting and analyzing data on energy consumption and efficiency measures.
Foundational data infrastructure aligns with the digital transformation agenda to leverage technology for efficient energy data management and analysis.
Foundational data infrastructure is an instance of data governance that ensures the quality, integrity, and accessibility of energy-related data.

level 2.Subject: energy markets
level 2.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 2.Subject: energy markets
level 2.Description: Energy markets employ renewable energy technologies to diversify the energy mix and reduce dependence on fossil fuels.

level 2.Subject: energy data analytics
level 2.Description: Energy data analytics implements the Energy Efficiency Policy to optimize energy consumption and reduce waste.

level 2.Subject: energy data analytics
level 2.Description: Energy data analytics focuses on analyzing data related to renewable energy sources to identify trends and opportunities.

level 2.Subject: energy modeling
level 2.Description: Energy modeling implements the Energy Efficiency Policy to optimize energy consumption and reduce waste.

level 2.Subject: energy modeling
level 2.Description: Energy modeling funds research and development projects to improve energy efficiency and renewable energy technologies.

level 2.Subject: energy data repositories
level 2.Description: Energy data repositories implement data privacy and security measures to protect sensitive information.

level 2.Subject: energy data repositories
level 2.Description: Energy data repositories provide funding for initiatives related to data privacy and security.

level 3.Subject: energy markets
level 3.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 3.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 3.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

level 3.Subject: climate change scenario analysis
level 3.Description: Climate change scenario analysis implements sustainable energy projects to mitigate the impacts of climate change.

level 3.Subject: energy efficiency
level 3.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.
